qas.question: Which two people helped lift Victoria's body into the coffin?

answers.text: Edward VII, the Kaiser and Prince Arthur, Duke of Connaught

qas.question: What item from her wedding was Victoria dressed in inside her coffin?
What color was her dress?
Who's dressing gown was placed by her side?
What year did Queen Victoria die?
What clothing was Queen Victoria laid to rest in?

answers.text: a white dress and her wedding veil

qas.question: A plaster cast of what part of Alberts body was placed in the coffin with the Queen?
What was placed in the Queens left hand when she was placed in her coffin?

answers.text: a lock of John Brown's hair

qas.question: Where was the funeral of Queen Victoria held?
What did Victoria wear upon her death in her coffin?

answers.text: She was dressed in a white dress and her wedding veil

qas.question: Whose lock of hair was concealed in her left hand by flowers?
When did John Brown give Victoria his mother's wedding ring?
When was Queen Victoria's funeral held?
Where was Queen Victoria laid to rest after her death?

answers.text: Frogmore Mausoleum at Windsor Great Park

qas.question: Where was Victoria laid to rest?

answers.text: Frogmore Mausoleum at Windsor Great Park

qas.question: When was Queen Victoria's funeral held?
What was hidden in Queen Victoria's hand by her father's family?

answers.text: a lock of John Brown's hair, along with a picture of him

qas.question: How was Victoria dressed for burial?

answers.text: a white dress and her wedding veil

qas.question: Who placed Victoria into her coffin?

answers.text: Edward VII, the Kaiser and Prince Arthur, Duke of Connaught

plausible_answers.text: Edward VII, the Kaiser and Prince Arthur, Duke of Connaught

qas.question: Which three people helped lift Victoria's body into the coffin?
What item from her wedding was Victoria not dressed in inside her coffin?
What color wasn't her dress?
Who's dressing gown was placed outside?
What year didn't Queen Victoria die?

context: In <a4_0><b23_0>1897<b23_0/><a4_0/>, Victoria had written instructions for her funeral, which was to be military as befitting a soldier's daughter and the head of the army, and white instead of black. On 25 January, <a0_0><a18_0><b19_0>Edward VII, the Kaiser and Prince Arthur, Duke of Connaught<b19_0/><a18_0/><a0_0/>, helped lift her body into the coffin. <a9_0>She was dressed in <a5_0><a17_0>a <a2_0><b21_0>white<b21_0/><a2_0/> dress and her <a1_0><b20_0>wedding veil<b20_0/><a17_0/><a9_0/><a5_0/><a1_0/>. An array of mementos commemorating her extended family, friends and servants were laid in the coffin with her, at her request, by her doctor and dressers. One of <a3_0><b22_0>Albert's<b22_0/><a3_0/> dressing gowns was placed by her side, with a plaster cast of <a6_0>his hand<a6_0/>, while <a7_0><a16_0>a lock of <a10_0>John Brown<a10_0/>'s hair<a7_0/>, along with a picture of him<a16_0/>, was placed in her left hand concealed from the view of the family by a carefully positioned bunch of flowers. Items of jewellery placed on Victoria included the wedding ring of John Brown's mother, given to her by Brown in <a11_0>1883<a11_0/>. Her funeral was held on <a12_0>Saturday, <a15_0>2 February<a15_0/><a12_0/>, in <a8_0>St George's Chapel, Windsor Castle<a8_0/>, and after two days of lying-in-state, she was interred beside Prince Albert in <a13_0><a14_0>Frogmore Mausoleum at Windsor Great Park<a14_0/><a13_0/>. As she was laid to rest at the mausoleum, it began to snow.
